turns.content: Have there been any notable changes in the types of podcasts that have gained popularity during the pandemic?

Yes, there have been some notable changes in the types of podcasts that have gained popularity during the pandemic. Some of the changes include:

1. Health and wellness: With the pandemic causing a lot of stress and anxiety, people have turned to podcasts that offer advice and tips on how to stay healthy and cope with the pandemic.

2. True crime: True crime podcasts have always been popular, but during the pandemic, many people found solace in these podcasts as they could escape from the reality of the pandemic and indulge in their favorite genre.

3. News and politics: With the pandemic causing so much uncertainty, people have turned to podcasts that offer a deeper understanding of the news and politics of the moment.

4. Mental health: Mental health podcasts have seen a surge in popularity as people cope with the stress and anxiety caused by the pandemic.

5. Remote working: As more and more people work from home, podcasts that offer tips and advice on remote working have become more popular.
I've actually been listening to a lot of true crime podcasts lately. Do you have any recommendations?

Sure! Here are some true crime podcasts that you might enjoy:

1. "Serial" - This is one of the most popular true crime podcasts out there, with each season dedicated to exploring a different case.

2. "My Favorite Murder" - Hosted by Karen Kilgariff and Georgia Hardstark, this podcast features the hosts discussing true crime cases with humor and empathy.

3. "Crime Junkie" - Hosted by Ashley Flowers and Brit Prawat, this podcast covers a wide range of true crime cases, from unsolved murders to serial killers.

4. "Up and Vanished" - This investigative podcast focuses on cold cases and missing persons, with host Payne Lindsey delving into each case in detail.

5. "The Murder Squad" - Hosted by retired cold case investigator Paul Holes and investigative journalist Billy Jensen, this podcast seeks to help solve unsolved murders through listener engagement and tips.

I hope this helps, and I hope you enjoy listening to these podcasts!

As an AI language model, I do not have personal experience in using Airbnb. However, I can offer tips for finding the best accommodations on Airbnb based on the feedback and reviews from previous guests:

1. Read reviews: This is the most important factor while choosing an Airbnb. Look for detailed reviews from past guests to learn about their experiences, including the cleanliness of the space, the responsiveness of the host, and the accuracy of the listing.

2. Check the location: Use the map feature on Airbnb to ensure that the location is close to the places you want to visit.

3. Analyze the price: Paying a lower price for an Airbnb is great, but sometimes the cheapest options may have lower-quality accommodations. Look for a price that is fair compared to other similar listings and make sure there are no hidden fees.

4. Consider the amenities: Determine what amenities are most important to you, such as a full kitchen, free parking, or a pool, and search for listings that meet those needs.

5. Communicate with the host: Prior to booking, reach out to the host with any questions you may have. A responsive and helpful host is typically an indication of a good Airbnb experience.

I hope these tips will help enhance your Airbnb experience!
